intro: Cardenanthus venturii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often appearing in the early morning. The plant has hairy, blue-green leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Botanically, it belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
